content.title: National Water Awards
content.beneficiary: Civil Societies, Gram Panchayats, Urban Local Bodies, Water User Associations, Institutions, Corporate Sector, Individuals
content.details: National Water Awards under the Department of Water Resources, River Development, and Ganga Rejuvenation encourage various stakeholders to adopt innovative practices of groundwater augmentation by rainwater harvesting and artificial recharge, promoting water use efficiency, recycling & re-use of water, and creating awareness through people's participation in targeted areas resulting in the sustainability of groundwater resources development and adequate capacity building amongst stakeholders.
benefits: Trophies and citations for the Best State and Best District in each of the five zones.

Trophies, citations, and cash prizes for winners in various categories including Best Village Panchayat, Best Urban Local Body, Best School or College, Best Industry, Best Civil Society, Best Water User Association, and Best Individual for Excellence.
content.application_process: Applicants must register online, choose the type (Individual or Organization), provide necessary details, and submit the application through the official portal.
documents_required: PowerPoint Presentation of around 6 slides covering the details of work carried out.
Supporting newspaper coverage and photographs, if any.

faqs.question: What are the National Water Awards?
faqs.answer: The National Water Awards are an initiative to recognize and celebrate outstanding achievements and contributions in the field of water resources management, conservation, and sustainability across India.

faqs.question: Who organizes the National Water Awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are typically organized by the Ministry of Jal Shakti, Government of India, or other relevant government agencies responsible for water resources management.

faqs.question: What types of achievements do the National Water Awards recognize?
faqs.answer: The awards recognize achievements in various areas such as water conservation, rainwater harvesting, groundwater recharge, efficient water use, wastewater treatment and reuse, river rejuvenation, and community-based water management.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in Awards?
faqs.answer: Individuals, organizations, institutions, local bodies, NGOs, industries, and government agencies involved in water conservation and management activities in India are eligible to participate.

faqs.question: Can projects/initiatives from all states participate?
faqs.answer: Yes, projects/initiatives from all states and union territories of India are eligible to participate in the National Water Awards.

faqs.question: Is there a fee to participate in the National Water Awards?
faqs.answer: No, there is usually no participation fee required to enter the National Water Awards.

faqs.question: What are the Eligibility of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Any State, District, Village Panchayat, Urban Local Body, School, College, Institution, Industry, Civil Society, Water User Association and an Individual who has done good work in the field of water conservation and management is eligible to apply.
